metadata.feature_description: Analytics dashboard for blog content including post views, comments, and engagement

steps.action: Navigate to PersonaBar > Dashboard > Community Analytics
steps.expected: Community Analytics dashboard opens with module tabs
steps.actual: Community Analytics dashboard opened showing tabs for Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki

steps.action: Click on Blogs tab to view blog-specific statistics
steps.expected: Blogs analytics dashboard displays with blog-specific metrics
steps.actual: Blogs tab selected, showing Community Health section with 5 blog-specific metrics, Engagement chart, Creates & Views chart, Trending Tags, and Popular Content sections

steps.action: View blog comment-related metrics in Community Health section
steps.actual: Comment-related metrics displayed: 'Blogs older than 24 hours without Comments' (0%) and 'Blogs with more than 2 deleted comments' (0%)

steps.action: Search for blog author activity monitoring in the Blogs analytics dashboard
steps.expected: Dedicated section or metrics for monitoring individual blog author activity
steps.actual: No specific blog author activity monitoring UI found. Dashboard shows aggregate blog metrics but no individual author statistics. Code review confirms the dashboard focuses on content-level analytics rather than author-level analytics.

issues: No dedicated blog author activity monitoring feature found in the UI. The suggested test scenario 'Monitor blog author activity' does not have a corresponding UI element in the Blogs Module Analytics dashboard.

steps.action: Verify Popular Content section is displayed in Blogs analytics
steps.expected: Popular Content section shows popular blog posts or empty state message
steps.actual: Popular Content section displayed with heading 'Popular Content' and message 'No popular content available in selected period' (indicating the feature works but no data exists)

steps.action: Review all blog-specific metrics in Community Health section
steps.expected: Blog-specific health metrics are displayed with percentage values
steps.actual: All 5 blog-specific Community Health metrics displayed: 1) Blogs older than 6 hours with no Views (0%), 2) Blogs older than 24 hours without Comments (0%), 3) Blogs with more than 2 deleted comments (0%), 4) Blogs with more than 1 edit within 24 hours of publishing (0%), 5) Blogs older than 12 hours with Views but no Interaction (0%)

steps.expected: Engagement section shows Interacted, Formed Relationship, and Shared metrics
steps.actual: Engagement section displayed with: Engagement 0%, Interacted 0, Formed Relationship 0, Shared 0

steps.action: Verify Creates & Views metrics are displayed
steps.expected: Creates & Views section shows create and view counts
steps.actual: Creates & Views section displayed with CREATES: 0 and VIEWS: 0

steps.action: Click on date range selector to view period options
steps.expected: Period selection dropdown appears with Day, Week, Month, Year, Custom options
steps.actual: Period selector dropdown displayed with options: Day, Week, Month (selected), Year, Custom

steps.action: Select 'Year' to change the time period for comparison
steps.expected: Dashboard updates to show yearly data range
steps.actual: Dashboard updated successfully. Date range changed from '9 Jan 2026 - 8 Feb 2026' (Month) to '9 Feb 2025 - 8 Feb 2026' (Year). Chart X-axis labels changed from days to months (FEB through JAN)

observations: The Blogs Module Analytics dashboard is part of the combined Community Analytics dashboard that shows all social modules (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki) in a tabbed interface.

Code review confirms the suggested scenario 'Monitor blog author activity' does not have a corresponding UI implementation. The dashboard focuses on content-level aggregate analytics rather than individual author statistics.
The Comparative Term dropdown allows comparison with previous periods (1 y, 1 m, 1 w, 1 d) which enables year-over-year, month-over-month comparisons.
Export functionality is available via an 'Export' button that generates Excel spreadsheets of the analytics data.
All metrics show 0% values as expected for a test environment with no blog activity data.
